decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Grief, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate. The key strategy is to combo off by using powerful reanimation targets like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push to protect the combo and deal with opposing threats. The goal is to win the game through early aggression and graveyard shenanigans.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by playing hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration with cards like Sol Ring, Ancient Tomb, and the Moxes to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland and Strip Mine. The goal is to slow down the opponent's game plan while advancing your own to secure a victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play early in the game, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay to control the game and protect its key pieces. Show and Tell and Flash provide additional ways to cheat creatures into play, while Bolas's Citadel can generate card advantage and close out the game quickly. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a dominant board presence with its powerful creatures.
